intro: Urtica blanda, commonly known as smooth nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It features heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, stinging hairs, which can cause a rash upon contact. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, appearing in clusters, and it is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Urtica blanda plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including pollinators and various insect species.
